name: The Twins, Hand In Hand Against Infamy Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: When was the design for the project of building the World Trade Center unveiled?
questions.explanation:
January 1964.

	The design was the work of Seattle born architect, Minoru Yamasake.

Emory Roth and Sons.

	The Port Authority was the agency given the task of building the whole project.

questions.text: Excavated material from the construction site of the WTC added how many acres to the site of Battery Park City and the World Financial Center?
questions.explanation:
23.

	The landfill was added to what was then the most valuable land in the country.

questions.text: Among the numerous archaeological relics unearthed during construction, was an almost perfect what?
questions.explanation:
1749 British half penny.

	Other artifacts found were, anchors, clay pipes, hand blown drinking glasses, cannon balls and other old coins.

questions.text: The elegant restaurants 'Windows on the World' and 'Cellar in the Sky' were located in the World Trade Center.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The restaurants attracted such celebrities as Frank Sinatra, John Lennon, Mick Jagger and Liza Minnelli.

questions.text: Sculptures and tapestries were displayed in the public areas of the World Trade Center. Which of these artists did not have their work on display there?
questions.explanation:
Artur Braganza.

	Other artists featured were, Louise Nevelson, Fritz Koenig and Masayuki Nagare.

questions.text: Where in the WTC complex was the Commodities Exchange located?
questions.explanation:
4 World Trade Center.

	Just one of the thousands of tenants that were based in the complex.

questions.text: Which government agency had its headquarters at Six World Trade Center?
questions.explanation:
U.S. Customs Service

	The Port Authority, who were the landlords of the complex, also had their headquarters within it.

questions.text: For approximately how long did the Twin Towers hold the title of 'tallest buildings in the world'?
questions.explanation:
One year.

	They were surpassed by Chicago's Sears Tower in 1974.

questions.text: The whole project for the Center was opposed by a committee called, 'Committee for a Reasonable World Trade Center', which was led by Lawrence A. Wein. Which famous landmark did he control?
questions.explanation:
The Empire State Building.

	The pretext for the opposition was that the size of the complex would be four times bigger than necessary, and would undermine the entire market for Manhattan office space.
